review.summary: This is a clean, well-structured Python package initialization file for event commands in the neo-commons platform. It follows proper Python packaging conventions with appropriate imports and __all__ definition. The file serves as a clear public API boundary for the commands module, exposing three command classes: CreateEventCommand, ProcessEventCommand, and RetryEventCommand. The implementation adheres to neo-commons architectural patterns including proper import organization and explicit public API control.

positive_observations.observation: Uses comprehensive __all__ list for explicit public API control, following neo-commons standards
Clean relative imports following feature-based import patterns (from .module import Class)
Proper module documentation with clear purpose statement
Minimal and focused - contains only necessary exports without clutter
Alphabetical ordering of imports and __all__ entries for maintainability

context.tests: No tests needed for __init__.py files - they are tested implicitly when importing commands
context.documentation: Adequate inline documentation for module purpose
context.configuration: No configuration required for this initialization file
